page.title: 03Landscape
page.content:
The area lies in{BRECKLAND}which is a{lowland area}with distinctive and individual characteristics.
It is a{low plateau between 100 {and 200 feet above sea level.}The sub-soil is a mix of chalk, gravel, sand, loam and chalky boulder clay, but the area is unified by sand covering these deposits. Often the sand is only a few inches in depth, but in some places it is several feet.
The{sandy soil}forms a perfect filter bed absorbing water with great rapidity, and even during the heaviest showers pools of water are not formed on the surface.{The rainfall is low and the bulk falls in the summer, so much is lost by evaporation.
(continued on Page 4)
